comments:
If you truly have oily skin, you know the difference in a review from someone with oily skin vs someone whos skin gets oily.  I have oily skin and probably spend upwards of $1K a year on products trying to find things that actually do as they claim, and this is one of them.

I was a little reluctant to purchase this as the price is pretty high for a brand I've never used, but I'm glad that I took the risk on it.  Prior to this moisturizer I was either using none at all (because most others just make me more oily, dont need redundant products on oily skin), or I was using the La-Roche Posay Toleriane Double Repair Matte one which didn't do much for me. Obviously how this will work for you is going to be different for everyone, and the other products you use prior to your moisturizer will make a difference as well.

For reference I am a 28 yr old female, white/Caucasian.  My morning routine is: wash with a clay based cleanser (Dermalogica), tone (Fenty Skin), hyperpigmentation serum (Good Molecules), niacinamide/zinc serum (Sunday Riley), then this moisturizer. The consistency of this product is great for oil as it is a gel based product, but it comes out more opaque white than clear which is fine. It does not have much of a fragrance that I have noticed, but I'm not sensitive to fragrance so I wouldn't be one to say. When I put this on it almost feels as if it is a crossover between a moisturizer and a makeup primer that blurs your pores.  Now it does not make your pores go away by any means, but it does HELP.  Immediately after applying my skin is definitely mattified but again, not completely shine free as if it is a primer with the sole purpose of making your skin look like it has powder on it. My skin was inflammed, my eczema bumps started to show up around my eyes and mouth, and my skin began to chafe. I was so worried about what to use and looked all over for something. I decided that because the cleanser has done so well, I would hope that this moisturizer would too. AND IT HAS. I freak out and read multiple reviews on a product before buying it because I hate wasting the money and also hate making my skin worse by accident. I also know my skin can be very problematic which is frustrating, but this stuff works. Pros: quickly controlled my dry, flaky skin; felt nice on my extremely irriatated skin (barely any sting); has lasted all day with the help of another product layered on; calmed my skin down in a matter of minutes.

Overall, I will be using this religiously for the time being until my face gets under control, and I am interested in looking for a lighter, daytime moisturizer by this brand for when my face doesn't need such a rich formula. I included the first photo, what my face looked like when I woke up around 10 am today and I was freaking out and in pain, what my face looked like 5 minutes after putting on the moisturizing cream in the Ulta bathroom right after I purchased it (still in my car outside the store lol) at around 11:30am, and what it currently looks like at 3pm after also applying the Honest brand ointment, which I'm using as a safer alternative to vaseline/aquaphor to lock in the moisturizer when my face is this bad. I truly hope this helps someone!!!
